snippet: The coating, meant to protect the stomach, interfered with the way the drug entered the body, arguing against the notion that some people are “aspirin resistant,” a study found.
abstract: Study, partly financed by Bayer, and published in the journal Circulation, says that commonly used coating on aspirin meant to protect the stomach may interfere with how drug enters the body, arguing against notion that some people are 'aspirin resistant.'
lead_paragraph: The coating, meant to protect the stomach, interfered with the way the drug entered the body, arguing against the notion that some people are “aspirin resistant,” a study found.

headline.main: Study Raises Questions on Coating of Aspirin
headline.print_headline: Study Raises Questions On Coating Of Aspirin
